titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Retail Clerks International Association, Local 1115E, Retail Furniture Employees Union Records WAG.277
titlestmt.author: Tamiment Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 16:03:20 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Retail Clerks International Association, Local 1115E, Retail Furniture Employees Union Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Retail Clerks International Association. Local 1115E (Retail Furniture Employees Union)

did.abstract: The Retail Furniture Employees Union became a Local of the Retail Clerks International Association.The collection contains election materials, correspondence, fliers for protests, speeches, and a program for dinner and dance put on by the local.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection, provenance is unknown but may have been donated by Adele Hector on behalf of the D'Angelo family. The accession number 1950.246 is associated with this collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1949-1962, are expected to enter the public domain in 2083.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Retail Furniture Employees Union became a Local of the Retail Clerks International Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This small collection contains some of the records of the Retail Furniture Employees Union which had become a Local of the Retail Clerks International Association. The collection contains election materials, correspondence, fliers for protests, speeches, and a program for dinner and dance put on by the local.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Retail Clerks International Association, Local 1115E, Retail Furniture Employees Union Records; WAG 277; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist; materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
